summary:
The success of my ventures in Ethiopia, Rwanda, Colombia and the Netherlands is grounded in my understanding of the technical aspects of agriculture, agri-business value chains and food processing, my political awareness and sensitivity, and my proficiency in communicating at different levels with various stakeholders.
 
In 2004, I co-founded a consultancy and research organisation, Resilience B.V., which currently has offices in the Netherlands, Benin, Rwanda, Ethiopia, Mozambique, Colombia and Indonesia. As general manager and consultant of Resilience, I have established and maintained partnerships with the private and public sectors,
and completed projects on market access, business models, agronomy and soil science. I have secured funding for many projects that have attracted grants of millions of euros.

Since 2020, I have directed most of my time to steering and providing technical support to TRAIDE foundation. At TRAIDE, we aim to solve critical global challenges by assisting (Dutch) companies, investors and service providers to start or intensify their operations in Africa and Latin America. TRAIDE takes a collaborative approach to join forces with local implementing organisations.

projects: [{'title': 'Program Coordinator Traide Rwanda', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'description': "TRAIDE Rwanda's mission is to promote the transition from aid to trade in developing countries and emerging economies. TRAIDE Rwanda aims to facilitate this transition by (1) identifying, developing and stimulating sustainable and responsible trade, investment and knowledge exchange between the European Union and emerging economies; and (2) developing and promoting local entrepreneurship. \nAs a project coordinator, I am overall in charge of the project success. Hiring staff members, providing technical advice and managing the budget.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Gertjan', 'last_name': 'Becx', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director TRAIDE Foundation & Entrepreneur'}]}, {'title': 'Dutch Chapter of the Ethiopian Jobs Compact', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'description': 'The project explores the opportunities for a Dutch Chapter of the Jobs Compact in Ethiopia. The Jobs Compact is a strategy to expand the industrialization agenda of the Ethiopian government while creating jobs for both Ethiopian citizens and refugees on the one hand, while addressing irregular migration on the other. The strategy aims to provide durable solutions for the protracted refugee situation in the country. During the Leaders’ Summit on Refugees and Migrants, which took place on 20 September 2016 in New York, the Government of Ethiopia committed itself to nine pledges that target more opportunities for refugees in the country. \nDifferent options for a Dutch Chapter of the jobs compact are proposed and currently implemented in Ethiopia as a result of the study. ', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Gertjan', 'last_name': 'Becx', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director TRAIDE Foundation & Entrepreneur'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Auke', 'last_name': 'Boere', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Business Development Coordinator Türkiye, South-Eastern Europe and Central-Asia at Netherlands Enterprise Agency (RVO)'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Anniek', 'last_name': 'Elemans', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Program Officer at TRAIDE Ethiopia'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Hiwot', 'last_name': 'Tadesse', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Project Officer'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Rixt', 'last_name': 'Komduur, PhD', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Secretary academic board Wageningen University  and senior policy advisor.'}]}, {'title': 'Lead consultant in a baseline assessment of the developmental impact and risk of current barley production in Zambia and opportunities to improve impact and reduce risks', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'description': 'Zambia Breweries (ZB) initiated a program in 2009 to locally procure the barley required for their breweries.  While the primary business objective of the barley program is to deliver malt to the brewery at a total cost that is, on average, less than the cost of landed imported malt, it is also important that it achieves a net positive local economic and social contribution and does not cause unintended negative economic or social consequences. Therefor this assessment regarding the developmental impact and risk of the ZB barley program was initiated and carried out in collaboration with Resilience BV.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Gertjan', 'last_name': 'Becx', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director TRAIDE Foundation & Entrepreneur'}]}, {'title': 'Lead consultant end of project evaluation of Oxfam’s Accenture Foundation funded projects on coffee in Limu, Ethiopia and sisal in Kishapu, Tanzania', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'description': 'Over a three-year period (2009-2011), Oxfam, supported by a grant from Accenture and Accenture Foundation, has been developing scalable business models to link smallholder producers with private sector companies within sustainable value chains. A high quality coffee value chain in Limu, Ethiopia and a sisal value chain in Kishapu, Tanzania were developed successfully. In both cases smallholders were sustainably linked to profitable (inter) national markets. Both cases have been evaluated and an extensive report has been written.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Gertjan', 'last_name': 'Becx', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director TRAIDE Foundation & Entrepreneur'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jasper', 'last_name': 'van der Linden', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Researcher and data-analyst at Independent Science'}]}]

TRAIDE aims to facilitate this transition by (1) identifying, developing and stimulating sustainable and responsible trade, investment and knowledge exchange between the European Union and emerging economies; and (2) developing and promoting local entrepreneurship.

TRAIDE foresees that, within 15 years, local partnerships will have been built in at least 10 countries. We aim to achieve this by implementing different programmes and projects embedded in the local context.', 'title': 'Managing Director', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}, {'location': 'Wageningen, Gelderland, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'TRAIDE Foundation', 'description': 'After establishing the Organization I was asked to join as the treasurer of the board.', 'title': 'Board Treasurer', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 163765, 'name': 'FAO', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQGkEw1cImNSTQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1539165866324?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=ybNUe1PH5-8lftGdCyp169yRTYUqpWpGGU1r79VXzBk', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/fao/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Mozambique', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'FAO', 'description': 'Initially I worked as an International Consultant on ‘Best Practices and Recommendations for Smallholder Aggregation and Agriculture Cluster Business Models in Mozambique’.

Later, I worked work as a Private Sector Specialist to develop the market credibility and image of dryland products from a specific region and a critical mass of market influence, making it easier to negotiate favourable market conditions. Specifically, I focused on covering the six FAO-led countries, namely Angola, Botswana, Malawi, Namibia, Tanzania and Zimbabwe, particularly on aspects relating to the selection and prioritisation of dryland value chains, and mapping of producer organisations and SMEs at the country level.', 'title': 'International Consultant', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 2407056, 'name': 'Resilience BV', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQEK1sjtBEs-aQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1519868245422?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=V5QXbqdIvdXDbORomyfb1SnJhep0JOACueNjJ5WzLyc', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/resilience-bv/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2004}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Wageningen', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2004}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Resilience BV', 'description': 'Resilience is a dynamic consultancy specialising in agricultural research and project implementation. Resilience combines new insights and research methodologies and applies them to water engineering, agri-business and value-chain development in order to deliver tailor-made services and products in developing countries.
 
Resilience starts from the premise that development challenges often arise from a complex socio-technical background. This implies that changing existing structures and generating agricultural growth necessitate a sound understanding of the systems in place. With offices in Addis Ababa (Ethiopia), Chimoio (Mozambique), Kigali (Rwanda) and Bandung (Indonesia), Resilience ensures that it is embedded in the local context and has adequate, on-the-ground, local expertise.

As one of the founders of Resilience B.V., I have been involved in the organisation’s strategic direction and implementation of many of our assignments.', 'title': 'Founder / Senior Consultant', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 2290240, 'name': 'Solynta', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQE1wqZ8VHy0ag/company-logo_400_400/0/1626340650931?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=L6qxAN4tQG-uBurYh9ZU2DU0W5xEEorhIMhX0ssRjxA', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/solynta/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Wageningen', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'Solynta | hybrid potato breeding', 'description': 'At Solynta, I was responsible for business development and projects in Africa. Key projects in Rwanda, Zimbabwe and Mozambique, and trials in 11 other African countries, focused on supplying true potato seeds to farmers, contributing to increased food security by developing relationships with our key partners, and setting up trials and sales outlets.', 'title': 'Business Developer Africa', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 166859, 'name': 'Wageningen University & Research', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C510BAQFQJQXtOy2Stw/company-logo_400_400/0/1519889640020?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=DfM4gdRk76TMhZBoa5gWFhnkNZBuUm47LktavPNU9gg', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/wageningenuniversity/', 'employees': {'start': 5001, 'end': 10000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Addis Ababa, Ethiopia', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'company': 'Wageningen University & Research', 'description': 'The aim of the five-year ENTAG programme was to support sustainable agri-business development in Ethiopia in collaboration with the Dutch private and public sector. Hands-on financial and legal support, innovation funds and technical support were given to the Ethiopian and Dutch private sector to catalyse sustainable development in Ethiopia. As Project Manager and later as Project Advisor, I was responsible for the day-to-day management of the programme, providing technical support to companies working in the spice, legumes, sesame, dairy poultry and aquaculture sectors. Besides supporting individual companies, the programme also helped to set up, sponsor and support different private sector associations and business support organisations (BSOs). My role was to manage the overall project with our team and provide technical support and training.', 'title': 'Program Manager Ethiopia Netherlands Trade for Agricultural Growth  (ENTAG) ', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}, {'location': 'Addis Ababa, Ethiopia', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'company': 'Wageningen University & Research', 'description': 'I was responsible for establishing the office of Wageningen University and Research in Ethiopia. This entailed renting office space, hiring coordinating staff members, and supporting the establishment of the financial system. In 2016, over 20 staff members were employed to coordinate, among other things, the Bilateral Ethiopia-Netherlands Effort for Food, Income and Trade (BENEFIT) Partnership, including ENTAG, CASCAPE, ISSD, SBN and DairyBiz programmes.', 'title': 'Commercial Representative of Stichting DLO / Wageningen UR in Ethiopia', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 69144327, 'name': 'Addis Ababa Chamber of Commerce and Sectoral Associations', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQHn4uSxGCtSTg/company-logo_400_400/0/1603093638439?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=9XrqbY1Gcin-3wxVSDyfYSU2BmW5-yrHqcxQ_SzI834', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/addischamber/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Addis Ababa, Ethiopia', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'company': 'Addis Ababa Chamber of Commerce and Sectoral Associations', 'description': "The ABSF project's goal was to strengthen Ethiopian agri-business by supporting entrepreneurs to establish companies, create business links, and support young entrepreneurs with business plans and funding. We also strengthened the Ethiopian poultry, dairy, aquaculture, potato, soy and
spice value chains through private sector platforms, creating and supporting BSOs and grant money for innovations and studies.

My role as Project Advisor was to lead a team of seven at the Chamber of Commerce, provide training, technical agri-business and financial advice, and provide a bridge between the donor, AACCSA, and the other stakeholders.", 'title': 'Project Advisor Agri Business Support Facility', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 166859, 'name': 'Wageningen University', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C510BAQFQJQXtOy2Stw/company-logo_400_400/0/1519889640020?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=DfM4gdRk76TMhZBoa5gWFhnkNZBuUm47LktavPNU9gg', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/wageningenuniversity/', 'employees': {'start': 5001, 'end': 10000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'company': 'Wageningen University & Research', 'description': 'As a PhD researcher, I reviewed the effectiveness of different business models linking smallholders to markets, including different organisational forms, contracts and pricing structures.
